file_insights.changes: Added import statements for 12 checklist-related schema classes
file_insights.purpose: Centralize schema exports to make checklist schemas accessible from app.schemas module

patterns_discovered.description: All checklist schemas follow the pattern of [EntityName][Action/Type] (Create, Update, Response)
Schema imports are organized by domain entities (approval, area, file, audit, checklist)
patterns_discovered.significance: Maintains modular structure while centralizing exports

patterns_discovered.description: Multi-line imports wrapped in parentheses for 12 related classes from checklist module
patterns_discovered.significance: Improves readability for large import groups

gotchas_discovered.description: The __init__.py file imports schemas without verifying they exist in app.schemas.checklist module
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: If any of the 12 classes don't exist in checklist.py, imports will fail at runtime

gotchas_discovered.description: The module doesn't define __all__ to explicitly control namespace exports
gotchas_discovered.impact: All imported items become accessible, but implicit rather than explicit

approach_outcome.notes: Task was completed successfully on first attempt by adding 12 checklist schema imports to the centralized __init__.py file, following existing patterns in the codebase

recommendations.rationale: Makes public API explicit and improves IDE autocompletion

recommendations.recommendation: Consider adding docstrings to schemas module
recommendations.rationale: Documents the purpose of each schema type (Create, Update, Response patterns)

recommendations.recommendation: Verify all 12 checklist schema classes exist
recommendations.rationale: Ensure app/schemas/checklist.py actually exports all imported classes to prevent runtime import errors
